definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to take possession of/to occupy/to take up

sentences.english: First put your arm through the sleeve, now put your head through.
sentences.chinese: 先把你的肐膊伸進袖子，現在把你的腦袋鉆出來。

sentences.english: The male beyond the bond is fond of the second wonderful diamond.
sentences.chinese: 那位不受約束的人喜懽第二顆奇異的鉆石。

sentences.english: At the base of the goblet is an 18-karat gold bracelet with 1 carat of white diamonds.
sentences.chinese: 高腳杯的底部是一個鑲着1克拉白鉆的18K金圓環。

definition: to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain
hammer/to hammer into shape/weight (e.g. of a steelyard or balance)/to strike with a hammer
to indulge in flights of fancy (idiom)/to let one's imagination run wild
pincers/pliers/tongs/claw (of animal)/to grasp with pincers/to pinch/to clamp/to restrain/to restrict/to gag
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]
to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
